intro: Elaeodendron glaucum var. kamerunense, commonly known as the Cameroon blueleaf, is a shrub native to the tropical rainforests of Cameroon. It is characterized by its glaucous, waxy leaves that have a bluish-green hue, giving it its common name. The plant typically grows to a height of about 1–2 meters and has small, clustered yellow flowers. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory properties. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited geographic distribution.
